column1: #Text=Ad-hoc Liaison Committee meets in Oslo , Norway
#Text=The AHLC ( Ad-hoc Liaison Committee ) met in Oslo , Norway on June 7 and 8 to discuss the Palestinian economical situation in Oslo .
#Text=Its mission is to bring the key donors of aid and relief together with the Israeli and Palestinian governments to address the current state of affairs between the two countries .
#Text=The AHLC keeps track on how donor countries interact with the Palestinian authorities and how the support they provide is handled .
#Text=The press conference on the first day with Foreign Minister Jonas Gahr Støre and Palestinian Prime Minister Salam Fayyad .
#Text=Early on the first day , Norwegian Foreign Minister Jonas Gahr Støre and Palestinian Prime minister Salam Fayyad both expressed optimism and hope for the Palestinian situation .
#Text=Minister Støre underlined the importance of continuing aid , but stated that he understood that most countries still had problems because of the world economic crisis .
#Text=As for the unstable political situation in Palestine , Prime Minister Fayyad explained that " the political instability is also a reason why we need more aid . "

#Text=During the second day , a press conference with Minister Støre clarified the motives of the donations saying , " It ’s is important to stress that donors are not doing this as a humanitarian project .
